xwikidoc.name: medsavantArchive20130528
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 28 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <BogdanVancea1_> has joined #medsavant 10:50 <BogdanVancea> has joined #medsavant 11:12 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 11:19 <sdumitriu1> Hey BogdanVancea 11:19 <sdumitriu1> What are you working on? 11:19 <BogdanVancea> Hello sdumitriu1 11:19 <BogdanVancea> checking out some code 11:19 <BogdanVancea> on Medsavant 11:19 <BogdanVancea> I was getting ready to send out a mail on the dev mailing list 11:19 <BogdanVancea> ;)) 11:20 <BogdanVancea> and how are you? 11:21 <sdumitriu1> Very busy... Lots of work to do, I just got another batch of requests last night 11:21 <sdumitriu1> Most of them I've fixed already, but there are some major refactorings needed 11:22 <BogdanVancea> I see 11:24 <BogdanVancea> and you're working on Phenotips? 11:24 <sdumitriu1> Yes 11:25 <BogdanVancea> ah 11:25 <BogdanVancea> I'm wondering, should I use the dev mailing list for all the questions I have about the project? 11:26 <BogdanVancea> sincer it's mostly just you on the irc 11:27 <sdumitriu1> Well, if they're important questions, send them by email 11:28 <sdumitriu1> But if it's something quick I might be able to answer faster here 11:28 <sdumitriu1> I'm sorry that Marc isn't more available, but this summer he's very busy, caught between several obligations 11:29 <BogdanVancea> it's okay 11:30 <BogdanVancea> I'll just ask you then :) 11:30 <BogdanVancea> is Medsavant fully ported to Maven? 11:30 <BogdanVancea> I havent seen any major changes on the github repo 11:31 <sdumitriu1> I still have to commit the Maven build 11:31 <BogdanVancea> I see 11:31 <sdumitriu1> The problem is that there are many dependencies that don't have a Maven artefact available 11:31 <sdumitriu1> So I'm trying to find and build each such project to resolve the Jar hell... 11:32 <BogdanVancea> ugh, that's not a very fun task 11:32 <sdumitriu1> I think I'll push what I have so far 11:32 <sdumitriu1> Indeed 11:32 <BogdanVancea> ;)) 11:32 <sdumitriu1> I spent a couple of days looking for projects 11:34 <sdumitriu1> But this is normal lab software development, it's gonna be a while until I can instill some good practices 11:34 <BogdanVancea> hehe 11:34 <BogdanVancea> I like the checkstyle plugin 11:34 <BogdanVancea> for Maven 11:35 <sdumitriu1> Yep, it's great 11:35 <BogdanVancea> the one you had set up for Phenotips 11:36 <BogdanVancea> also, could I use Spring for the development on Medsavant? 11:37 <BogdanVancea> once the project is fully mavenized 11:39 <sdumitriu1> Hm, I think that's a major change 11:39 <sdumitriu1> It's too dangerous 11:39 <sdumitriu1> I agree that it should be componentized somehow, but you should focus on your own goals 11:41 <BogdanVancea> I was asking because I used spring data in the past for working with Solr 11:42 <BogdanVancea> but maybe it's better if I do something similar to what you did on phenotips 12:25 <sdumitriu1> Still waiting for that email from you... 12:30 <BogdanVancea> sorry, I received a call and didn't manage to finish it up 12:30 <BogdanVancea> you mean the mail to the dev list, containing what I plan to do this week, right? 12:31 <sdumitriu1> Yes 12:32 <sdumitriu1> As you said, "I was getting ready to send out a mail on the dev mailing list" 12:32 <BogdanVancea> that's true, it's half written 12:32 <BogdanVancea> but I started to ask you some questions 12:35 <marta> has joined #medsavant 12:46 <BogdanVancea> sent the email 12:46 <BogdanVancea> hello Marta 12:47 <marta> hi BogdanVancea 12:49 <BogdanVancea> are you also an active dev for Medsavant? 12:54 <marta> no, but i'm one of the ccm org admins which means i have to keep an eye on all gsoc projects 12:54 <BogdanVancea> oh, I see 12:57 <BogdanVancea> is everyone subscribed to the dev list for medsavant? 12:58 <BogdanVancea> since I've sent the last mail just to the medsavant dev list 12:58 <BogdanVancea> should I include more people in the cc field when I send more emails? 12:58 <sdumitriu1> Yes, everybody involved is subscribed 12:59 <BogdanVancea> ah, ok 13:00 <BogdanVancea> you said in the email you've send the other day that there was a try to add Solr support for medsavant 13:01 <sdumitriu1> Yes, Brian said he'll search for the code 13:02 <BogdanVancea> ah, okay 13:03 <BogdanVancea> and it didnt work? 13:04 <sdumitriu1> Not really, it took a day to index just a few genomes, with only a few attributes 13:04 <sdumitriu1> And that was considered too much 13:05 <BogdanVancea> ah 13:05 <sdumitriu1> So the experiment didn't go too far 13:06 <BogdanVancea> I did some tests indexing data myself 13:06 <BogdanVancea> and it was really slow if you index over http 13:07 <sdumitriu1> Well, it's going to be slow anyway 13:07 <marta> correction: not a few genomes, they indexed one chromosome 13:07 <marta> a small one :) 13:07 <sdumitriu1> That's why sharding is important 13:07 <marta> +1 13:08 <sdumitriu1> And we'll have to accept that indexing big data sets is slow, and rethink the software a bit 13:08 <BogdanVancea> hmm 13:08 <BogdanVancea> how large is a chromosome? 13:08 <sdumitriu1> Instead of starting with an empty database everytime, either package a pre-indexed starting core, or use a remote service 13:08 <BogdanVancea> roughly, how much data? 13:09 <BogdanVancea> And the indexing part is sort of tricky 13:10 <BogdanVancea> sincer at the moment Solr has a fixed configuration 13:10 <BogdanVancea> and you'd need to reindex everything if you want more shards 13:34 <BogdanVancea> awesome :D 13:34 <BogdanVancea> this means I can build the project with a different IDE than Netbeans? 13:36 <sdumitriu1> I'm not sure 13:37 <sdumitriu1> It compiles, but last time I tried to run it it didn't work 13:37 <BogdanVancea> I'll give it a try 13:37 <sdumitriu1> There may be something wrong 14:37 <sdumitriu1> BogdanVancea: Any success with the build? 14:39 <BogdanVancea> no, it fails 14:39 <BogdanVancea> but I need to get the latest commits 14:39 <BogdanVancea> and try again 14:39 <sdumitriu1> Yes 14:39 <sdumitriu1> It should work after that, since it correctly works on http://ci.cs.toronto.edu/jenkins/ 14:40 <BogdanVancea> it keeps downloading jars 14:40 <BogdanVancea> so its fine until now 14:43 <BogdanVancea> build succesfull 14:43 <BogdanVancea> awesome 15:21 <BogdanVancea> sdumitriu, did you manage to run it succesfully? 15:22 <sdumitriu1> No, I've switched back to PhenoTips 15:23 <BogdanVancea> ah, okay 15:33 <BogdanVancea> I think I'm going to go for a shower and then to bed 15:33 <sdumitriu1> OK 15:34 <BogdanVancea> talk to you tomorrow then 15:34 <BogdanVancea> gnite 15:34 <sdumitriu1> Yep 15:34 <sdumitriu1> Good night 23:18 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant
